column5: We usually purchase the 8-day license to cover the week when we go up to Ontario Canada fishing. This year we are going for 9 days and will purchase a full-year license. Is the 1-year Sport Fishing License good 1 year from date of purchase or do they go from January 1 - December 31? We're doing a fall trip this year and a late spring trip next year. If the license goes 1 year from date of purchase, we can cover two trips with a single annual license.
good from jan1 till dec 31 same year
Love them one year from date of purchase licenses. I can usually get 3 trips out of them. Late spring, fall and early spring the next year.
They are only good for Jan 1 - Dec 31. 2018 seasonal license expired January 1.
Wondering if fish cops accept confessions.
Not sure if they accept confessions but they do accept Visa and Master CardüëÆüèª*‚ôÄÔ∏è

Thanks for the information, I went ahead and purchased a 1-year license. Now I just have to figure out how to sneak in a road trip to Erie or Lake St Clair to hold me off until our scheduled fly-in trip in September.
Here's the confession I was questioning.

Wasn't referring to Ontario licenses. The second poster already had answered that question. I fish multiple states, and some do the 1 year from date of purchase. So if I buy a license in the middle of April, I can fish a 10 day April trip, a 10 day fall trip, and another trip early April of the next year, all on 1 license.

I'm a Canadian and I fish Vermont and NY Vermont is from January to December and NY is from the date of purchase Quebec is from April to March. Ontario I don't need a licence because I'm over 65 and a Canadian resident. I'm paying around 30% on the exhange
